hh3cSmlk.name: hh3cSmlk

revisions.description: Initial revision of the Smart Link MIB module.

hh3cSmlk.contactinfo: Platform Team Hangzhou H3C Tech. Co., Ltd. Hai-Dian District Beijing P.R. China http://www.h3c.com Zip:100085
hh3cSmlk.description: This MIB defines objects for managing Smart Link. Smart Link is a feature developed to address the slow convergence issue with STP. It provides link redundancy and fast convergence in a dual uplink network, allowing the backup link to take over quickly when the primary link fails.

hh3cSmlkGroupTable.name: hh3cSmlkGroupTable
hh3cSmlkGroupTable.description: A list of entries of a smart link group.

hh3cSmlkGroupEntry.name: hh3cSmlkGroupEntry
hh3cSmlkGroupEntry.description: A list of parameters that describe a smart link group.

hh3cSmlkGroupID.name: hh3cSmlkGroupID
hh3cSmlkGroupID.description: An index that uniquely identifies an entry in the smart link group table.

hh3cSmlkDeviceID.name: hh3cSmlkDeviceID
hh3cSmlkDeviceID.description: Device ID of a smart link group. The device ID is the bridge MAC of the device.

hh3cSmlkPreemptionMode.name: hh3cSmlkPreemptionMode
hh3cSmlkPreemptionMode.description: Preemption mode of a smart link group.

hh3cSmlkSpeedThreshold.name: hh3cSmlkSpeedThreshold
hh3cSmlkSpeedThreshold.description: Speed threshold for a smart link group in speed mode. This object is valid only when the value of hh3cSmlkPreemptionMode is 'speed'.

hh3cSmlkPreemptionDelay.name: hh3cSmlkPreemptionDelay
hh3cSmlkPreemptionDelay.description: Preemption delay for a smart link group, in the range of 0 to 300 seconds.

hh3cSmlkControlVlanID.name: hh3cSmlkControlVlanID
hh3cSmlkControlVlanID.description: Index of the control VLAN specified for a smart link group. The value 65535 indicates that the control VLAN has not been configured.

hh3cSmlkInstanceListLow.name: hh3cSmlkInstanceListLow
hh3cSmlkInstanceListLow.description: Each octet contained in this value specifies an eight-instance group, with the first octet specifying instances 0 through 7, the second octet specifying instances 8 through 15, and so on. Within each octet, the most significant bit represents the highest numbered instance, and the least significant bit represents the lowest numbered instance. Each instance to which the protected VLANs of a smart link group are mapped corresponds to a bit within the value of this object. A bit with a value of '1' indicates that the VLANs mapped to the instance are protected VLANs of the smart link group. The VLANs mapped to the instance are not protected VLANs if the corresponding bit has a value of '0'. The value of this object must be set with hh3cSmlkInstanceListHigh at the same time when a SET operation is performed.

hh3cSmlkInstanceListHigh.name: hh3cSmlkInstanceListHigh
hh3cSmlkInstanceListHigh.description: Each octet contained in this value specifies an eight-instance group, with the first octet specifying instances 2048 through 2055, the second octet specifying instances 2056 through 2063, and so on. Within each octet, the most significant bit represents the highest numbered instance, and the least significant bit represents the lowest numbered instance. The most significant bit of the last octet is invalid. Each instance to which the protected VLANs of a smart link group are mapped corresponds to a bit within the value of this object. A bit with a value of '1' indicates that the VLANs mapped to the instance are protected VLANs of the smart link group. The VLANs mapped to the instance are not protected VLANs if the corresponding bit has a value of '0'. The value of this object must be set with hh3cSmlkInstanceListLow at the same time when a SET operation is performed.

hh3cSmlkGroupRowStatus.name: hh3cSmlkGroupRowStatus
hh3cSmlkGroupRowStatus.description: This object is responsible for managing creation, deletion, and modification of rows. The rows support active status, CreatAndGo, and destroy operations.

hh3cSmlkPortTable.name: hh3cSmlkPortTable
hh3cSmlkPortTable.description: A list of port entries of a smart link group.

hh3cSmlkPortEntry.name: hh3cSmlkPortEntry
hh3cSmlkPortEntry.description: A list of parameters that describe a port to be added to a smart link group.

hh3cSmlkPortIfIndex.name: hh3cSmlkPortIfIndex
hh3cSmlkPortIfIndex.description: IfIndex of a port in a smart link group.

hh3cSmlkPortRole.name: hh3cSmlkPortRole
hh3cSmlkPortRole.description: Role of a port in a smart link group.

hh3cSmlkPortStatus.name: hh3cSmlkPortStatus
hh3cSmlkPortStatus.description: Status of a port in a smart link group.

hh3cSmlkLastFlushTime.name: hh3cSmlkLastFlushTime
hh3cSmlkLastFlushTime.description: Time when the last flush message was transmitted.

hh3cSmlkPortRowStatus.name: hh3cSmlkPortRowStatus
hh3cSmlkPortRowStatus.description: This object is responsible for managing creation, deletion, and modification of rows. The rows support active status, CreatAndGo, and destroy operations.

hh3cSmlkFlushEnableTable.name: hh3cSmlkFlushEnableTable
hh3cSmlkFlushEnableTable.description: A list of ports on which flush message receiving is enabled.

hh3cSmlkFlushEnableEntry.name: hh3cSmlkFlushEnableEntry
hh3cSmlkFlushEnableEntry.description: A list of parameters that describe a port on which flush message receiving is enabled.

hh3cSmlkIfIndex.name: hh3cSmlkIfIndex
hh3cSmlkIfIndex.description: IfIndex of a port on which flush message receiving is enabled.

hh3cSmlkControlVlanListLow.name: hh3cSmlkControlVlanListLow
hh3cSmlkControlVlanListLow.description: Specifies the control VLANs used for receiving flush messages. The VLAN ID range, described by bitmap, is from 1 to 2048. The length of bitmap is 256 in bytes. Each octet within this value specifies a set of eight VLANs, with the first octet specifying VLANs 1 through 8, the second octet specifying VLANs 9 through 16, and so on. Within each octet, the most significant bit represents the highest numbered VLAN, and the least significant bit represents the lowest numbered VLAN.

hh3cSmlkControlVlanListHigh.name: hh3cSmlkControlVlanListHigh
hh3cSmlkControlVlanListHigh.description: Specifies the control VLANs used for receiving flush messages. The VLAN ID range, described by bitmap, is from 2049 to 4094. The length of bitmap is 256 in bytes. Each octet within this value specifies a set of eight VLANs, with the first octet specifying VLANs 2049 through 2056, the second octet specifying VLANs 2057 through 2064, and so on. Within each octet, the most significant bit represents the highest numbered VLAN, and the least significant bit represents the lowest numbered VLAN.

hh3cSmlkGroupLinkActive.name: hh3cSmlkGroupLinkActive
hh3cSmlkGroupLinkActive.description: A trap message is generated when the status of a port in a smart link group changes to active.
